bill_title: provide for an order of joint physical care over certain children whose parents exercise joint legal custody.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for an order of joint physical care over certain children whose parents exercise joint legal custody. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 25-5 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If joint legal custody is awarded, pursuant to § 25-5-7.1, to both parents, the court may also award joint physical care to both custodial parents upon the request of either parent. If the court denies a request for joint physical care, the determination shall be accompanied by specific findings of fact and conclusions of law that the awarding of joint physical care is not in the best interest of the child. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for an order of joint physical care over certain children whose parents exercise joint legal custody. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 25-5 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If joint legal custody is awarded, pursuant to § 25-5-7.1, to both parents, the court may also award joint physical care to both custodial parents upon the request of either parent. If the court denies a request for joint physical care, the determination shall be accompanied by specific findings of fact and conclusions of law, whether oral or written, that the awarding of joint physical care is not in the best interest of the child. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
